intro: Cistus × laxus var. subhirsutus, commonly known as the hairy rockrose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features dense, evergreen foliage with small, leathery leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained, alkaline soils and is well adapted to dry, rocky environments. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
